body.p: If you take the London Chatham and Dover Express (for Rochester Bridge) from Victoria Station at 4.20 on Monday, I think you will find ChorleyHenry Fothergill Chorley (1808-72; Dictionary of National Biography), music critic and miscellaneous writer; on staff of the Athenaeum since 1835. Close friend of CD, and contributor to All the Year Round. – and LayardAusten Henry Layard (1817-94; Dictionary of National Biography), excavator of Nineveh and radical politician. Liberal MP Aylesbury 1852-7; Under-Secretary for Foreign Affairs 1852, 1861-6; Liberal MP for Southwark 1860; knighted 1878. – in the train, coming down here.
